Description: Akzo Nobel agreed to settle allegations that from 2000 to 2003 two of its subsidiaries authorized and made $279,491 in kickback payments in connection with their sales of humanitarian goods to Iraq under the U.N. Oil for Food Program.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/litigation/litreleases/2007/lr20410.htm
Included in a dataset downloaded at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Company is plan administrator. Penalty amount reported in range of $10,001 to $50,000.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Info Source: https://www.fmcsa.dot.gov/regulations/enforcement/national-listing-enforcement-cases-subject-name-closed-fiscal-year-2006-pdf
Notes: Year is fiscal year. Date is closing date.

Description: Dutch chemical giant, Akzo Nobel Chemicals BV, agreed to plead guilty and pay a $12 million criminal fine for participating in an international conspiracy to fix prices and allocate market shares of monochloroacetic acid (referred to as MCAA).
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/atr/public/press_releases/2001/8468.htm

Description: Solvay S.A., a Belgian company, and Akzo Nobel Chemicals International B.V., a Dutch company, agreed to plead guilty and to pay a total of more than $72 million in criminal fines for their participation in international price-fixing cartels in the chemicals industry.
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/atr/public/press_releases/2006/215056.htm

Description: A group of 11 companies agreed to pay a total of $25.03 million to settle multistate litigation alleging they conspired to fix the prices of vitamins added to foods such as ready-to-eat cereals. The announcement did not specify how much each company would pay. Here we assume the total was divided equally among them.
Info Source: http://www.illinoisattorneygeneral.gov/pressroom/2009_12/20091202.html

Description: Akzo Nobel Surface Chemistry, LLC agreed to pay a $37,500 civil penalty in settlement of allegations it polluted Aux Sable Creek and violated a permit.
